metadata.title: CVE-2012-4734 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Request Tracker (RT) 3.8.x before 3.8.15 and 4.0.x before 4.0.8 allowsremote attackers to conduct a "confused deputy" attack to bypass the CSRFwarning protection mechanism and cause victims to "modify arbitrary state"via unknown vectors related to a crafted link.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.0.7-2
rt4-apache2 - 4.0.7-2
rt4-clients - 4.0.7-2
rt4-db-mysql - 4.0.7-2
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.0.7-2
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.0.7-2
rt4-fcgi - 4.0.7-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.7-2').
